result.execSummary:
The defendant Keanu J. Feuerstein was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Keanu J. Feuerstein is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • Keanu J. Feuerstein was found guilty of Possession of Methamphetamine, a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(g).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

civilJdgmts.propDescr: Civil Judgment for unpaid court obligations.

supervisions.notes:
If probation is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution to victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.
Concurrent with: Pierce County Case 14CF112 and 16CF221

miscConds.notes: Eligible upon successful completion of probation.

Provide DNA sample.
Comply with any conditions imposed by Agent.

11:04 Defendant Keanu J. Feuerstein in court with attorney Donald J. Schwab.  Sean Edward Froelich appeared for the State of Wisconsin. 14CF122, 16CF221 and 17CF224 heard at this time.  Froelich has reviewed the revocation summary. Froelich requests time served on 14CF112, 14CF122 and 16CF221. 103 days credit. Requests civil judgment on court costs on 14CF112, 14CF122 and 16CF221. Atty Helgeson and Def agree. Court; 14CF112 30 days time served. 16CF221 time served.  14CF122 time served. days credit is 103 days. Civil judgment on court costs still owed on 14CF112, 14CF122 and 16CF221.   Appeal rights are given to the defendant.
Sentencing hearing on revocation on November 7, 2017 at 10:30 am.
from Probation and Parole Agent S Drazkowski re: recommending 6-7 months on 14CF122 and 16CF221 and 3-4 months on 14CF112 to run concurrent.
Defendant's Judgment of Convictions. Return to Senter. Attempted Not Known
Pierce County DNA Proof of Submission

11:53 a.m.  Defendant Keanu J. Feuerstein in court with attorney Donald J. Schwab.  Sean Edward Froelich appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Includes 14CF122 and 16CF221.  Froelich, plead guilty to possession of methamphetamine, S/W 2 years. 16CF221 -  Judge reviews plea waiver with defendant.    Constitutional rights explained to defendant  Exam'd re: understanding of law, penalty and rights.    DEF PLEADS GUILTY to possession of methamphetamine in 16CF221.    Facts are correct.    COURT ACCEPTS PLEA, FINDS DEF FREELY, INTELLIGENTLY, KNOWINGLY & UNDERSTANDINGLY MADE AND WAIVES CONSTITUTIONAL RIGHTS  The court finds the defendant guilty and adjudicates defendant guilty of possession of methamphetamine.  Court orders S/W, 2 years probation, no specific conditions.  Eligible for expungement upon successful completion. Court costs in the amount of $515. DNA sample and surcharge.    14CF112 and 14CF122, court enters judgments of conviction.  14CF122, S/W, 2 years probation concurrent, eligible for expungement upon successful completion of probation. Court costs in the amount of $515. DNA sample and surcharge.    14CF112, S/W, 1 year probation concurrent, eligible for expungement upon successful completion of probation.  DNA sample and surcharge.  Costs in the amount of $443.  Appeal rights are given to defendant.
Sentencing hearing on July 17, 2017 at 11:45 am.

10:36  This includes 14CF122,16CF221    . Attorney Donald J. Schwab in court.  Sean Edward Froelich appeared for the State of Wisconsin. The defendant does not appear for hearing.  The State requests a warrant on each case.  The Court orders warrant on all 3 cases.

9:06  This includes 14CF1121 and 14CF122Attorney Donald J. Schwab in court.  William Harold Thorie appeared for the State of Wisconsin. No appearance by the defendant. The court does revoke the DJOC on 14CF114 and 14CF221 and enters judgment on them . Will set for sentencing and follow with 16CF221.  Donald Schwab addresses the court. The defendant did contact PD yesterday and they appointed Donald Schwab to represent.
Sentencing hearing on June 12, 2017 at 10:30 am.
